arm_group.description: Acrysof Toric intraocular lens in congenital cataract

brief_summary.textblock:
This study was conducted to evaluate changes of reduction of corneal astigmatism with toric
      intraocular lens(IOL) in congenital cataract.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reduction of Corneal Astigmatism With Toric Intraocular Lens Implantation in Congenital Cataract

detailed_description.textblock:
This retrospective study included 6 eyes from 4 patients (mean age 7.2 years) with
      congenital cataract who had an astigmatism of 2.5 to 4.0 D prior to cataract surgery. Review
      of preoperative and postoperative visual acuity (UCVA), refraction, toric axis was
      performed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children less than 14 years

          -  Congenital cataract at initial visit

          -  Symmetrical keratometric astigmatism more than 2.0 D

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Microcornea (horizontal corneal diameter less than 9.5mm-asper that particular age)

          -  Corneal pathology

          -  Keratoconus

          -  Irregular astigmatism

clinical_study.official_title: Reduction of Corneal Astigmatism With Toric Intraocular Lens Implantation : Early Results in Patients With Congenital Cataract

primary_outcome.description: Measurement of refraction after cataract surgery was performed.
primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in astigmatism after cataract surgery at 24 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Department of Ophthalmology, School of medicine, Kyungpook National University

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of visual acuity after cataract surgery was performed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in quality of vision after cataract surgery at 24 months.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
